%I A006317 M2631
%S A006317 1,3,7,12,19,27,37,46,58,71,86,102,121,137,157,178,201,225,253,276,
%T A006317 304,334,364
%N A006317 Maximum number of chess queens of 3 colors on an n X n board such that no queen attacks or protects another queen of its color.
%C A006317 Does the density approach a limit?
%D A006317 N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
%H A006317 Jon Perry, <a href="http://www.users.globalnet.co.uk/~perry/maths/kQueens/kQueens.htm">kQueens</a>
%H A006317 B. Recam√°n, <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/BF03024021">Chess queens, Problem 89-8</a>, Math. Intellig., 12 (No. 3, 1990), 65-68.
%e A006317 Examples to illustrate a(10) and a(11) (1,2,3 are colors; 0 is an empty square):
